lexUnit.name: rip.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: separate into pieces by tearing

sentence.text: She was chewing savagely on something , making nasal snarling sounds as she ripped the thing apart with her sharp teeth .
It was also the mortal enemy of horses and would rip them apart in seconds with its mighty talons .
Trolls are not very intelligent , but they are extremely strong , and can easily rip a man apart with their bare hands .
She ripped a cushion cover into strips and used them to make a gag .
Suddenly he reached across and snatched the photograph out of the Woman 's hand , ripping it in half and dropping the pieces on the floor .
She ripped him into little pieces .
Kruger 's hand trembled on the Luger , he wanted to kill Lais , rip her beautiful laughing throat to pieces .
If piranhas can rip a horse to pieces in no time , surely even a seven foot long otter offers little challenge ?
The same basic principle is used for the tearing apart of Miguel , who has been bitten and gone over to the zombies , letting them into the compound -- though they still rip him to shreds .
Everywhere French flags were ripped in half and trampled on and great gangs of young soldiers joined together to shout and curse the very name of France .
And when eventually the colobus had been ripped into pieces , and the forest went quiet , he pointed out the way the chimps shared their spoils with their nearest relatives .
In his head he saw the hung sheets dotted with coal-smuts torn from their pegs and ripped into bandages as they sailed above the foxgloves .
The Dionysian comes from Dionysius , the god of wine and fertility , who was worshipped with drunken orgies in the woods at which nonparticipants were ripped to pieces .
Then somebody got ripped apart by a diseased ferret , but only , alas , in my 90 - minute dream .
The revolution has ripped thousands of Cuban families apart , not the least of which is Castro 's own .

On top of the many sacrifices public servants already must make -- disclosure , lower pay , restrictions on what they can do after they leave -- they must increasingly bank on being gratuitously ripped apart by a totally politicized confirmation process .
The next morning , we awakened to find huge trees in the street , shattered glass on the sidewalks , and cafe awnings ripped in two .
'' I think it 's time for us to that are dividing America and ripping us apart , `` he declared in committee .
Marshall ( Harve Presnell , sounding like Bob Dole ) has ordered it out of a Lincolnesque compassion for all the families ripped apart by war .
well it it takes up less room i mean you you set the wood down and you move the saw whereas if you 're ripping wood you 're probably better off with a a table saw
